info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 2:28AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Mercer, Rock Island, west central Henry, southern Scott and east central Muscatine Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 228 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Illinois City, or 7 miles east of Muscatine, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blue Grass, Montpelier, Andalusia, Hamlet, Buffalo, Reynolds, Taylor Ridge, Rock Island, Milan and Oak Grove. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 4 and 5. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 9. Interstate 280 between mile markers 5 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
